title: Photography Terms
description: Test your knowledge of camera settings, techniques, and photography vocabulary

questions.question: In photography, what does 'aperture' control?
options: The size of the lens opening that lets in light

questions.question: What does 'ISO' refer to in camera settings?
In photography, what is 'bokeh'?
options: The aesthetic quality of the out-of-focus blur in an image

questions.question: What does 'depth of field' mean in photography?
options: How deep the camera lens is
The range of distance in a photo that appears acceptably sharp
The depth of the camera body
The number of layers in an image

questions.question: In photography, what is 'exposure'?
options: The amount of light that reaches the camera sensor

questions.question: What does 'golden hour' refer to in photography?
options: The period shortly after sunrise or before sunset with warm, soft light
The most expensive hour for studio rental
The first hour a camera is used

questions.question: In photography, what is a 'macro' lens used for?
options: Extreme close-up photography of small subjects

questions.question: What does 'white balance' control in a photograph?
options: The amount of white in the image
The color temperature to ensure white objects appear white
The contrast between light and dark

questions.question: In photography, what is 'shutter speed'?
options: How fast the camera turns on
The length of time the camera's shutter is open to expose the sensor to light
How quickly you can take consecutive photos

questions.question: What is 'composition' in photography?
options: The arrangement of visual elements within the frame of a photograph
The chemical process of developing film

questions.question: What does 'overexposed' mean in photography?
options: Too many people saw the photo
The image is too bright because too much light hit the sensor
The film was left in the camera too long

questions.question: In photography, what is the 'rule of thirds'?
options: A composition guideline that divides the frame into a 3x3 grid for balanced placement of subjects
Use only one-third of the frame

questions.question: What does 'RAW' mean in digital photography?
options: An uncompressed, unprocessed image file from the camera sensor

questions.question: In photography, what is 'vignetting'?
options: A darkening or fading of the edges and corners of an image

questions.question: What is a 'telephoto' lens primarily used for?
options: Photographing distant subjects by magnifying them
